root_causes: Flags missing values as errors even though the question is NotRequired (missing should be allowed).
Validation condition is inverted: uses 'if miss(x) or ~range(x,1,5) flag=1' instead of flagging only non-missing out-of-range values.
Does not enforce any uniqueness/ordering checks (ordering questions typically require each rank 1..5 to be used at most/once).
Does not honor the entry condition isTest() – the script never restricts checks to test mode.
No handling for possible special codes (97/98/99) — if special codes are used they must be allowed or explicitly handled.
instructions:
Do not flag missing values. Replace the per-variable check with: do repeat x=HidSec3ScnOrder_1 to HidSec3ScnOrder_5.
  if not miss(x) and ~range(x,1,5) flag=1.
end repeat.
This flags only non-missing values that are out of the 1..5 range.
Restrict the check to test mode per the entry condition. For example wrap the selection with the isTest() condition: temporary. sel if isTest() and flag>0. list ...

If order uniqueness is required, add a duplicate-check step. Example approach: compute counts for each rank 1..5 and flag if any count>1 or if completeness is required flag if any rank is missing:
compute dupflag=0.
vector v=HidSec3ScnOrder_1 to HidSec3ScnOrder_5.
loop #i=1 to 5.
  compute cnt=SUM(v(= #i)).
  if cnt>1 dupflag=1.
end loop.
if dupflag=1 flag=1.
(Adjust to require exactly one of each rank only if NotRequired==false.)

If the survey uses special codes (97/98/99) treat them as allowable values (or explicitly exclude them). Change the per-variable condition to:
if not miss(x) and NOT (range(x,1,5) or any(x,97,98,99)) flag=1.
so special codes are not flagged as invalid.
Remove final deletion or ensure flag is temporary only after use; ensure selection/listing occurs only when isTest() is true so production runs are not affected.

root_causes: The script flags missing responses (if miss(x)) even though the question is NotRequired (optional); missing should not be treated as invalid.
The expected entry condition is isTest() (show only in test mode), but the script does not restrict execution to test mode.
No handling/allowance for potential special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) or other permitted open-text markers is present; the script only accepts values 1-2.
Validation uses ~range(x,1,2) for both subquestions without confirming that this is the correct allowable set for each subquestion (possible mismatch with expected answer coding).
instructions: Do not flag missing values. Remove miss(x) from the invalid-condition. For example change 'if miss(x) or ~range(x,1,2) flag=1.' to only flag real invalid codes: 'if ~range(x,1,2) flag=1.' (or an equivalent that excludes missing).

Restrict the check to test mode per the entry condition. For example use a selection that includes isTest(): 'temporary. sel if isTest() & flag>0.' (or perform the validation only when isTest() is true).
Allow any special codes that are permitted (e.g. 97,98,99) when validating. For example change the check to treat these as valid: 'if ~(range(x,1,2) or any(x,97,98,99)) flag=1.'

Confirm the correct allowable values for each subquestion; if each subquestion should accept 1-2 then keep range(1,2). If their valid values differ, adjust the range/any() checks per variable (e.g. use explicit checks per subvariable rather than a blanket range).
Initialize the flag variable before the loop to avoid ambiguity. Example: 'compute flag=0.' before 'do repeat ...' so only explicitly flagged cases have flag=1.

root_causes: Missing entry condition isTest() — the script does not restrict checks to test mode as required
instructions: Include the isTest() entry condition in the selection. For example: sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,1,2)).
Ensure the selection parentheses are used so the logic is: isTest() AND (missing OR out-of-range).

root_causes: Missing entry condition isTest() — the script does not restrict the check to test mode as required by the expected logic.
instructions: Include the isTest() entry condition in the selection filter. For example: sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,1,2)).
Ensure the sel if line is placed after temporary. so the listing only runs in test mode.

root_causes: Missing entry condition isTest(): the script does not restrict the validation/listing to test mode as required by the expected logic.
Flag variable not initialized before use: flag is only set to 1 when an error is found, but not initialized to 0, so existing values (from earlier code) could cause false positives/negatives.
instructions: Add the test-mode restriction to the selection step. For example, replace the selection with: temporary. sel if isTest() & flag>0. (or ensure an initial sel if isTest() is applied before validation).
Initialize the flag variable to zero before the do repeat. For example, add: compute flag = 0. before the do repeat block so only detected issues set flag=1.

root_causes: Script references A4DKx2 (no suffix) but expected Variable ID is the sub-variable A4DKx2_99.
Does not check the expected sub-question variable (A4DKx2_99).
instructions: Use the correct sub-variable name in the checks and output. Replace references to A4DKx2 with A4DKx2_99.
Update the validation line to: temporary. sel if miss(A4DKx2_99) or ~range(A4DKx2_99,99,99). list respid, A4DKx2_99.
If there are additional sub-questions besides _99, add checks for each sub-variable (e.g., DO REPEAT over A4DKx2_#) rather than checking the parent variable name.

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() is not applied; script runs checks for all cases instead of only test mode.
instructions: Restrict the validation to test mode as specified. For example, before the DO REPEAT checks add: temporary. sel if isTest().
Or incorporate isTest() into each selection, e.g.: temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(v) or ~range(v,1,5)).
Keep the existing DO REPEAT over HidSec3ScnOrder_1 TO HidSec3ScnOrder_5 but ensure the isTest() filter is applied so only test records are inspected.

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() is not applied; script does not limit checks to test mode.
instructions: Apply the isTest() condition before running checks. For example: temporary. sel if isTest(). Then run the existing per-variable validations.
Alternatively, include isTest() in the sel-if expression for each variable, e.g.: temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1) or ~range(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1,2)).
Ensure both sub-variables (_1 and _2) are checked under the isTest() restriction.

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() is not applied; script checks all records instead of only test mode.
instructions: Restrict validation to test mode. For example: temporary. sel if isTest(). Then run: sel if miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,1,2). list respid, HidScn5Dn5EOrder1.
Or combine conditions: temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,1,2)).

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() is not applied; script checks all records instead of only test mode.
instructions: Restrict validation to test mode. For example: temporary. sel if isTest(). Then run: sel if miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,1,2). list respid, HidScn5Dn5EOrder2.
Or combine conditions: temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,1,2)).

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() is not applied; script checks the sub-variables for all cases instead of only test mode.
instructions: Apply the isTest() filter before the per-subvariable checks, e.g.: temporary. sel if isTest(). Then run checks for HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 and HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2.
Or include isTest() in each validation expression, e.g.: temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1) or ~range(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1,2)). Repeat for _2.
Ensure both sub-variables are validated under the isTest() restriction.
